statement.p: To find the distance across a river, a surveyor choose points A and B, which are 245 m apart on one side of the river. She then chooses a reference point C on the opposite side of the river and finds that \displaystyle\angle{B}{A}{C}\approx{79}^\circ and \displaystyle\angle{A}{B}{C}\approx{47}^\circ.
statement.em: NOTE: The picture is NOT drawn to scale.
statement.p: Approximate the distance from point A to point C.
Find the distance across the river.

p.em: Enter your answer as a number; your answer should be accurate to 2 decimal places.
